Title: N/A

reviewText: Hate is a word I don't throw around in reviews. I HATED THIS dvd.I have NEVER in my life seen a dance dvd that talked more about how to  dance than ACTUALLY moved. It's so utterly basic, that if you can stand up or have any confidence in being able to walk across the floor without falling down 25x on the way, you sure don't need this insult-to-breathing-people dvd. I have never seen so much blathering and useless commentary and stream-of-consciousness self-indulgence in so-called  'instructional' dance dvd - and the word 'dance'? Used very loosely, since there is none. If you can walk as slow as humanly possible across the floor (imagine you're dragging two broken legs on a desert island towards the sound of a ship approaching) - you don't need this dvd. You're well-past it in every possible regard.I honest to goodness cannot believe anyone liked this, but even more than that I can't believe people aren't outraged that this is allowed to be called a 'dance workout' or an 'instructional' anything. A room of kume-by-yah-ers aimlessly trying to find their inner sex-kitten? There is NO DANCE. It is SO misdirected, misstepped, misappropriated, and adle-brained and SLOW it's unreal. If it's self-help, lable it as so. If it's documenary and opinion and pop-psych for an hour about how you should love yourself at any size, lable it so. If it's dance instructional, shocking as it is -- I really expect some dancing!It should be labled PRE-DANCE PREPERATION 101. Not "The Art of Exotic Dancing." Or better yet, "Lets Talk about The Art of Exotic Dancing as We all Check to See Who Can Walk and Chew Gum at the Same Time."I can imagine that every dvd can offer something to someone, given that as human beings were are all of different temper and taste and need, but wow, if you are under 85 years old (and even if you're over!) buy this as a last resort and imagine every bad thing you can before you buy it because whatever you're imagining? it's only the tip of the iceburg.Yes, it's really that bad. I was utterly offended.Get Exotic Dance: the Irrestiable Art, which is slow as well, but teaches you lots of moves and is skillful and artful!I've felt ripped off before, and I understand that what you think you are getting is not always to your liking, that's part of the buyer-be-ware - and that's life: but this is so far beyond that, this was an absolute insult to my intelligence in every possible way as a buyer -- and as a dancer, it's white-gloves-face-slapping and pistols-at-dawn.Note: the other two in the series are also documentary-style commentaries/interviews as well. Short on dancing, long on reflecting.
summary: Ripped off - this is a documentary, not an instructional

reviewText: I thought I would learn a lot more, and possibly get some exercise - I did learn some moves, but that's really not what this tape is about.  It reminds me of a TLC or Discovery program!  The narration is terrific and the way it is filmed is very educational.  The commentary from the women taking the class is really interesting; they show you a woman performing the moves just perfectly and then show her saying how difficult it was for her, physically or emotionally.  Really eye-opening stuff.By the way, you WILL also learn sexy moves that will make your husband or boyfriend (or girlfriend!) DROOL!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Last year a group of us ended up in a strip club on Burbon Street in New Orleans. I admit I was uncomfortable but at the same time I was impressed by the relaxed sensual movements of the dancers. When I saw a DVD was available on exotic dancing I couldn't resist buying it to see if I too could learn the moves."The Art of Exotic Dancing" is a great idea! To teach women how to get in touch with their sensuality through exotic dancing. That is what this DVD sets out to do. And it succeeds to some extant but could be better.In the DVD a 40 something grandmother/exotic dancer shows a group of women how to move sensually. The students then try the move, translating it with their body. Everyone will do it a little differently.The moves are easy to learn. There are a just a few of them including hip rolls and walking. Though the movements are simple you realize how just a little different motion in your ocean can make your body so much more appealing.This is not an exercise workout. You will not feel the burn or get an aerobic workout. You will simply learn how to walk and move your body in a sexier fashion.Personally I did not feel the movements went into enough depth. More movements would have been better. Despite that the few movements taught were interesting.The biggest drawback to the DVD in my opinion was the clothing worn. The leader who has a very shapely body, wears a white grandma bra when she demonstrates some of the moves and an unflattering hankerchief top for other moves. For one scene she wears an ugly oversized man's shirt. Now come on..seduction can include what you wear. A crisp white mans shirt, a sexy top does not have to be sleezy to inspire. I must say that the one gal in Burbon Street "Rain" who got me thinking about how I moved wore a black, mesh top with minute sized flowers on it. Paired with 10 inch heels of course. She was very cute and not sleezy at all.Bottomline the video gets a few good points for teaching sensuous moves but I have to deduct several stars because just some simple things, more moves and better clothing  would have made it so much better.

reviewText: This is an instructional video/dvd on a few basic erotic dance moves.  This tape is not for people who have dance backgrounds or who are comfortable with erotic movements.  Women who need encouragement to become comfortable with touching themselves and moving erotically will get the most benefit from this tape.  For women who need advanced instruction on erotic dancing, I would suggest going to clubs and watching dancers or watching stripper videos/dvds.  (The second video in this series,"Develop Your Routine" is a good starting point also)
Title: N/A

reviewText: It starts with a 6 min intro with excessive camera effects & learning the background about the students. All during the practive & learning the students while talk about all their fears & worries.. a little is good, but they allow soo much, might make some woman have NEW worries.Walking: step, drag, step... for 8 min.Hip Rolls: regular ones for 6 min. Revolving/turning hip rolls for 7 min. Hip rolls while squatting 5 min. Hip rolls while kneeling for 6 min.Floorwork 13 min, : touch yourself all over for 2 min, recline back & arch for 1 min, leg circles in the air, slide them back & forth like a cricket, turn on side, arch again, trace again, turn over on stomach with spread legs, rock back & forth, spread legs, turn on side, touch self, leg in the air, crawling & talking tips, practice & students talking more.Striptease 3 min: students in better outfits doing the striptease w/o talking in betweenDress Up: students in their fav. outfits stripping while narrating over how they feelThere are some good moves, but I found Susan Bremer (Art of Sensual Dance) to be more sensual & less stiff while teaching. In this DVD, the pace was too slow & doens't teach very much. The DVD was filled with more about following the women students, talking all through, their thoughts, their pasts & opinions & watching their transformation.The teaching itself was good but only the basics, though slow, the music was a bit uninspiriing as well. This DVD is only for people who have no clue how to strip or be sexy at all.There's a trailer on their site & the overlaid music is a bit in the way. Also you'll see a lot of info about what the students think more then actual teaching... that's how the DVDs are.  It's at the artofexoticdancingTry something more sensual like "Art of Sensual Dance" by Susan Breemer, or more fun & more aerobics like Jeff Costa's Cardio Striptease (Either of his 2 disks), Carmen Electra's aerobic striptease (Disk 1 is best) , Exotic Dance for You, or Felinity.
summary: Ok, not enough content & WAY too much talking from students
